intro: Yulania dabieshanensis, commonly known as the Dabieshan chrysanthemum, is a rare flowering plant native to the Dabieshan Mountains in China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like yellow flowers that bloom in the autumn. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded forest environments and has lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. It is valued for its ornamental qualities and is also studied for its potential medicinal properties. Due to habitat loss, it is considered an endangered species requiring conservation efforts.
